Title: Library Enhancement, Data and Cheminformatics Scientist
Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people‚Äôs varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

A healthier future. It‚Äôs what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love.

That‚Äôs what makes us Roche.

In Roche‚Äôs Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organization (pRED), we make transformative medicines for patients in order to tackle some of the world‚Äôs toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicines. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.

In the Small Molecule Research department (SMR) in Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED), we generate molecular insights, and drive the discovery and development of small molecules from initial starting points to clinical candidates across the pRED discovery portfolio. In the Compound Library Enhancement and Logistics (CLEL) team, we supply research samples for all SMR portfolio projects and we are also the custodians of the Roche Corporate Compound Collection. Our key focus is to streamline and enable efficient drug discovery project design cycles with the provisioning of a well-balanced chemical space and the timely delivery of research samples that can be subjected to biological assays.

We are looking for someone to join our team in the Roche Innovation Center Basel to help us drive exploration and implementation of new computational approaches to visualize, develop and curate compound libraries as well as ensure translation into delivery of samples using cheminformatics and logistics workflows.

The opportunity

The broad objective of the position is to create workflows and tailored options providing access to chemical space for small molecule lead discovery, to develop and improve data processes and workflows towards sample delivery, and to deliver insights regarding chemical space optimization with a focus on lead discovery and relevant screening technologies, as well as their impact.

Specifically, you will:


develop and automate data workflows to ensure optimal use, maintenance and continuous improvement of the Roche Corporate Compound Collection and compound logistics execution
ensure accessibility of high quality chemical sets for lead discovery efforts by streamlining data flows and facilitate the interface to assay owners generating our data
expand existing or create novel solutions to optimize the performance of small molecule screening activities in close collaboration with other experts with pRED


Who you are:

You‚Äôre someone who wants to influence your own development. You‚Äôre looking to be part of a dynamic and cutting-edge organization where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and tasks. You are interested in making an impact by providing solutions, reducing complexity and connecting essential elements of the drug discovery process and are passionate about applying cheminformatics and data science to the biopharmaceutical industry.


You have a university degree, preferably a PhD, in cheminformatics, computer science or a life science discipline with a focus on computational science or data science
You have extensive working experience with state-of-the-art cheminformatics and data science technologies including programming languages, relational databases, and specialized toolkits (Python, RDKit, SQL, Java, R ‚Ä¶)
You must be familiar with common pipelining tools such as Pipeline Pilot or Knime and are fluent in generating interactive data visualisations with established tools (Spotfire, Vortex, Tableau, or open source tools)
You are a curious and quick learner, who uses strong analytical and problem solving skills to translate complex thoughts into practical applications and solutions including visualisations and statistical data analysis. An experience in statistics including statistical learning and machine learning is a plus
You have strong interpersonal skills to effectively influence, lead, advise, or consult experts in a matrix environment to jointly move projects forward and good presentation and communication skills in English


The scientific title of this position might be adjusted depending on the experience and seniority of the final candidate.

If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients‚Äô lives. If you want to work in a passionate team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now.

Our commitment

Roche commits to recognising talent and aptitude. We prioritise encouraging and supporting our employees on their personal journeys by providing a safe, creative space to help them reflect, make decisions and grow in their career.

We are confident that we find the most innovative solutions by gaining different perspectives, asking and answering hard questions, and challenging the status quo. Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious yet enthusiastic way; we are devoted to building a team that represents a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we‚Äôve become one of the world‚Äôs leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Basel is the headquarters of the Roche Group and one of its most important centres of pharmaceutical research. Over 10,700 employees from over 100 countries come together at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site, which is one of Roche`s largest sites. Read more.

Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.

We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion, and strive to identify and create opportunities that enable all people to bring their unique selves to Roche.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we‚Äôve become one of the world‚Äôs leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Title: Data Scientist | Cientista de Dados
Description:
O time de Preven√ß√£o de Fraudes IT para o Marketplace est√° procurando Cientistas de Dados Semi-Senior/S√™nior para se unir √† nossa equipe. Voc√™ ir√° trabalhar na gera√ß√£o, deploy e monitoramento de modelos de Machine Learning que ajudam a prevenir fraudes em nossa plataforma, tanto como na explora√ß√£o de perfis e casos emergentes em diferentes pontos do nosso ecossistema. Al√©m disso, ter√° um papel central na planifica√ß√£o e prioriza√ß√£o das diferentes iniciativas. A posi√ß√£o √© para Brasil, com a equipe sediada em S√£o Paulo.

O foco principal do time √© a preven√ß√£o de fraudes com oferta, oferecendo vis√£o tanto do lado do comprador quanto do vendedor.




Quais s√£o os desafios do cargo?

Desenvolver modelos de Machine Learning que permitam prevenir casos de fraude no Marketplace.
Analisar as diferentes casu√≠sticas de fraude no Marketplace por meio dos dados e propor m√©tricas para medir seu impacto.
Identificar oportunidades em diferentes marcas e casos de fraude, detectando padr√µes que possam ser usados para encontrar novas features, que ser√£o usadas tanto em regras quanto em modelos.
Investigar o estado da arte para o desenvolvimento de modelos mais avan√ßados que tenham impacto nas m√©tricas do neg√≥cio.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We're looking for a talented and passionate Data Scientist, to join Wildlife's Insights team.

As a Data Scientist, you will expand game potential by providing non-trivial solutions to business questions, such as how to analyze game performance, engage players, customize content, run successful experiments, and optimize game economy.

We know that the work we do has a high impact on our company's success and culture. The right person for this position is curious by nature, and comfortable in a "take the initiative" environment, loves solving problems, and can thrive in a fast and growing business.

What You'll Do


Enable game teams to make data-informed decisions by providing access to data, fostering best analytical practices and rigor, and creating analyses, tools, and models to solve specific game problems.
Accelerate game development by answering business questions quickly levering existing tools or building new ones.
Expand game potential by providing non-trivial solutions to business questions such as how to analyse game performance, engage players, customize content, run successful experiments, and optimize game economy.
Use experimentation and the scientific method to continuously iterate on your product ‚Äî the game.


What You'll Need


Knowledge of statistics and machine learning that is both deep and broad
1+ years of experience in working as a data scientist or machine learning engineer on technically challenging problems
Experience with product analytics


Nice to have


Knowledge of Looker


More About You


You can frame open-ended business problems and find creative solutions using data
You communicate in a structured way both speaking and writing, especially in English
You are autonomous in leading the execution of solutions proactively giving visibility to stakeholders and asking for help whenever needed
You promote rigorous but pragmatic analytical practices among other data scientists and business partners
You are driven by generating value and leverages a wide range of data science tools to do it ‚Äî not just ML models


About Wildlife

Wildlife is one of the leading mobile game developers and publishers in the world. We have released more than 60 titles, reaching billions of people around the globe. Today, we have offices in Brazil, Finland and the United States. Here, we create games that will excite, intrigue, and engage our players for years to come!

Equal Opportunity

Wildlife is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

We're committed to providing accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process.

Title: AI Data Scientist (Remote)
HTML:
Axurians are innovators at heart, driven by a mission to make the internet safer for everyone. Our core values of putting the customer first, taking true ownership, and pursuing smart results define our unique culture. We offer a dynamic and flexible environment where creativity, maturity, and initiative are celebrated. As part of our global, world-class team, you'll collaborate across borders to deliver cutting-edge external cybersecurity solutions. Join us at Axur, where your ideas and expertise will shape the future of digital experiences.

We believe in creating an inclusive hiring experience for everyone. With our fully online selection process, all stages are conducted remotely. If you require any accommodations, please let us know in the application form, where you can indicate any necessary adjustments, and we'll be happy to assist.

Do you have experience with commercial and open-source LMMs (Large Multimodal Models)? Are you interested in working in a dynamic and collaborative environment focusing on continuous improvement?

We are looking for an AI Data Scientist to join our team, supporting us in developing AI-based prototypes and products that can include generative AI models. An organized, communicative, and proactive person willing to analyze data in various formats, build data processing pipelines, and develop ML/AI models that deliver valuable insights to end users. And you can work remotely from anywhere in the world!

A typical workday might include:

  • Developing prototypes and AI-powered products using both generative and non-generative AI models;
  • Analyzing and processing data in different formats (text, tables, images, scripts in various programming languages, etc.);
  • Designing and implementing data pipelines for ML/AI models;
  • Training (fine-tuning) and deploying generative AI models for inference;
  • Contributing to AI-driven solutions, such as:
    • AI models for detecting vulnerabilities in code;
    • AI models for analyzing data breaches and identifying cases impacting customers

Requirements


Indispensable Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in an exact sciences field;
  • Strong knowledge of statistics, Python, and machine learning, including generative AI models;
  • Experience with LMMs, both commercial and open-source;
  • Experience in training (fine-tuning) and using (inference, prompt engineering) multi-modal generative AI models;
  • Fluency in English and Portuguese


Additional Qualifications:

  • Experience in cybersecurity;
  • Experience with AWS services (beyond machine learning), Docker, and inference frameworks (especially vLLM);
  • Postgraduate degree in machine learning or a related field with ML applications


Benefits

  • Home office assistance: an allowance of R$ 2,000.00 in the first month to buy all the items for your home office. Axur will send only the laptop (which must be returned to the company in case of departure);
  • Flexible benefit of R$ 990,00 per month;
  • Health insurance and dental plan (Bradesco Top Nacional);
  • Prudential Life Insurance;
  • Annual Employee Bonus Plan;
  • Possibility of Employee Stock Options Plan (equity participation in the company);
  • Anywhere Office work model;
  • Super flexible hours;
  • TotalPass;
  • Language classes and a platform for study with more than 25 idioms
  • Culture focused on the individual development of Axurians (360¬∫ evaluation and Individual Development Plan (IDP);
  • Agreements and partnerships for individual development (Coursera, Udemy, OpenEnglish, Fisk, MBA USP ESALQ, and others);
  • Internal Rewards Programs (Best Recruiters, and others)
  • Parental Leave Program (Pregnant and Companion; Adopter and Adaptation period)

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Experimentation
HTML:
About the Team


We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Sao Paulo team, specifically in Core Services Analytics.


You will work with product managers, engineers, and fellow data scientists to shape the direction of one or more products within Core Services. You will work on fast-moving, high-stakes problems reaching a global audience. A deep analytical passion and the ability to execute key business priorities is a must for this role.


Notes about the profile: If you are interested in advanced modeling and production modeling, this role is not it! We have a separate Applied Science team that works on these types of projects.


About the Role


  • Analyze key data assets to understand our payment experiences;
  • Develop and monitor strategic metrics and understand all underlying factors;
  • Design and run experiments to analyze the impact of product changes;
  • Deep dive into data to evaluate proposed product changes and identify opportunities for improving the user experience;
  • Collaborate with product managers and other business leaders to make decisions based on data insights and experiment results;
  • Communicate your findings to cross-functional peers and management.



Technical Skills


Required:


  • Advanced English skills;
  • Senior and/or Staff seniority in a Business/Data/Science role (6yrs+ of experience);
  • Previous experience improving products, understanding the user journey, and extracting insights from data;
  • Advanced SQL expertise;
  • Solid experience using Python or R;
  • Experience launching multiple experiments (such as A/B experiments) and an understanding of experimental design and using statistical methods in exploratory analysis;
  • Casual Inference experience is a huge plus;
  • Bachelors or M.S. in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields.



Please note: this hybrid position is based in S√£o Paulo, Brazil - welcoming both local professionals and those open to relocating to S√£o Paulo.

Title: Data Scientist - AI, Insights & Solutions
Description:
What we do

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join Bain‚Äôs Advanced Analytics Group (AAG). ¬†As part of AAG, you will work with other members of AAG, Bain Generalist Consultants and our AAG Factory team to build robust data solutions that interact with our Data Science and Machine Learning models to serve our clients needs.¬†We achieve this in two distinct ways:

Working with consulting teams on short-term projects which involve developing software solutions
Developing and maintaining long-lasting products that support internal or clients needs

At Bain, we work with leading companies innovating with data, often involving building digital products.

Many times, in the early stages of experimentation, we have to develop immature digital products as proofs of concept. Those can go from deploying a microservice with a predictive model, to quickly implementing pipelines that integrate client data with the developed products/models.

When any of those tests show potential value, we need to scale them up and help the team capture that unlocked value. Sometimes, this means transforming an immature digital project or product into a stable, usable, and resilient one and bring the most value to our clients.

Because of this, we are searching for innovative and fresh minds that want to join us to create elegant yet practical solutions to deal with the most challenging problems.

Who we are looking for

We are not looking for an expert on a specific domain or analytics framework. Instead, we are seeking people who have strong Data Science experience and feel comfortable moving through different types of data analysis and modeling challenges.

We are looking for individuals with experience building data-driven solutions, training machine learning models and integrating advanced analytics into business processes. Also, people that has worked with diverse data sources across different domains, and who can collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to drive insights and create analytic solutions from data.

While you may already have experience with certain tools or platforms, we encourage you to continually learn and adopt new technologies as you move forward. We want you to see learning as a challenge to embrace, not a chore

What we expect from you:

Enjoy learning new methodologies, tools and technologies
Familiar with statistics, linear algebra, databases and programming
Write code in Python
Skilled at manipulating data, extracting insights and communicating them through visualizations
Experience training machine learning models ‚Äì both supervised and unsupervised

About us

At Bain we say ‚ÄúChampion the bold to achieve the extraordinary‚Äù. By doing that, we aim to challenge the status quo and redefine the domains in which we work.

We are building the most influential data innovation hub in South America. We are looking for creative yet courageous professionals like you to play a key role in helping us pursue this endeavor.

What can you expect from us?

We are people centered and team players: we want to provide an awesome environment to work and grow. An environment where we care about people, our wellbeing and a healthy and vibrant long term development. We believe in a place where autonomy is at the core, and where servant leadership provides direction, guidance and motivation, enabling the best version of each of us so we can build teams based on trust and where we help others shine.

We deliver positive impact and challenge the status quo: we are obsessed with unleashing our clients full potential by developing quick and dirty data products that evolve fast through agile experimentation. We design a vision not conquered yet, and we only seek to make it a reality and bring true impact to the domains we work on. Be it a very complex operational mining process, an NGO‚Äôs educational challenge, a retailer‚Äôs e-commerce, or a climate change endeavor, we bring state-of-the-art advanced analytics techniques to create new superior realities for our clients.

We are playful and seek for uniqueness: complex problems require thinking out-of-the-box, giving room to challenging ideas and points of view. How we enable that? By nurturing creativity and having fun exploring novel paths and promoting curiosity and learning in empowered teams that take seriously their instincts and passions. We‚Äôve seen over and over again that this never-ending learning philosophy make us better and stronger, broaden our capability range and enlighten our version in the future to tackle challenges that we haven‚Äôt seen before.

What we do

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join Bain‚Äôs Advanced Analytics Group (AAG).  As part of AAG, you will work with other members of AAG, Bain Generalist Consultants and our AAG Factory team to build robust data solutions that interact with our Data Science and Machine Learning models to serve our clients needs. We achieve this in two distinct ways:

  • Working with consulting teams on short-term projects which involve developing software solutions
  • Developing and maintaining long-lasting products that support internal or clients needs

At Bain, we work with leading companies innovating with data, often involving building digital products.

Many times, in the early stages of experimentation, we have to develop immature digital products as proofs of concept. Those can go from deploying a microservice with a predictive model, to quickly implementing pipelines that integrate client data with the developed products/models.

When any of those tests show potential value, we need to scale them up and help the team capture that unlocked value. Sometimes, this means transforming an immature digital project or product into a stable, usable, and resilient one and bring the most value to our clients.

Because of this, we are searching for innovative and fresh minds that want to join us to create elegant yet practical solutions to deal with the most challenging problems.

Who we are looking for

We are not looking for an expert on a specific domain or analytics framework. Instead, we are seeking people who have strong Data Science experience and feel comfortable moving through different types of data analysis and modeling challenges.

We are looking for individuals with experience building data-driven solutions, training machine learning models and integrating advanced analytics into business processes. Also, people that has worked with diverse data sources across different domains, and who can collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to drive insights and create analytic solutions from data.

While you may already have experience with certain tools or platforms, we encourage you to continually learn and adopt new technologies as you move forward. We want you to see learning as a challenge to embrace, not a chore

Title: Artificial Intelligence Scientist
Description:
Are you looking to work at the forefront of Machine Learning and AI? Would you be excited to apply cutting-edge Generative AI algorithms to solve real-world problems with significant impact?

The AI Scientist Group at Applied Data Science Center at IQVIA is a strategic team that helps pharmaceutical companies and related institutions in life sciences implement AIML solutions and realize transformational business opportunities. This is a team of AI scientists, consultants and engineers working step-by-step with customers to build bespoke solutions that harness the power of machine learning and Generative AI.

The team helps pharmaceutical customers imagine and scope the use cases that will create the greatest value for their businesses, select, train, and fine-tune the right models, define paths to navigate technical or business challenges, develop proof-of-concepts, and make plans for launching solutions at scale.

Key Responsibilities:



Collaborate with internal teams and work directly with pharmaceutical/life sciences institutions to identify and address business needs with Generative AI applications.
Design and conduct experiments, research new algorithms, and innovate to optimize risk, profitability, and customer experience.
Develop, implement, and refine advanced Generative AI models to solve complex, novel problems.
Work with a multidisciplinary team to build and deploy scalable AI solutions.
Create proof-of-concepts and prototypes to showcase the potential of Generative AI technologies.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in Generative AI and machine learning, applying them to practical scenarios.
Provide technical leadership and mentorship to team members.
Present and explain AI solutions to non-technical stakeholders in customer-facing roles.
Apply consulting principles to deliver tailored AI solutions that meet specific client needs.


Required Qualifications and Skills:



Advanced degree (Ph.D. or Master‚Äôs) in Computer Science or a related field.
Proven experience in designing and implementing Generative AI models and algorithms.
Strong programming skills in Python, with hands-on experience in frameworks such as PyTorch, LangChain, GraphRAG, AutoGen, and various vector/graph databases (e.g., ChromaDB, Neo4j).
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure) and deploying machine learning models at scale, including Azure OpenAI Services.
Fine-tune and distill large language models to improve performance and efficiency
Deep understanding of standard machine learning techniques and cutting-edge Generative AI technologies.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to think creatively and critically.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, capable of explaining complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in customer-facing roles with strong consulting skills to understand and solve client needs.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Desire to work in a collaborative environment.


IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who We Are - Vision

DOJO Technology is a business company at Florian√≥polis SC, part of FCamara group, with 5 years of existence in the market helping our customers to find the path through DATA. We help our customers to find non-obvious relations with their own data, developing from descriptive to predictive tailor made solutions.

Our vision is to guide decision making based on non-obvious relationships, data analysis and intelligence.

OUR CULTURE & VALUES


Human Centric
Trust (the foundation of everything)
Commitment - related to attitude and interest in the whole


What You Will Do

You will be the analytical specialist focused on enabling technical solutions for complex business and technical problems to our customers. You need to be curious, passionate about technology and information, adept at problem-solving, and comfortable interacting with people. Additionally, you should have an in-depth understanding of statistics, probability, mathematics, and data modeling (Machine Learning)

Requirements

Fundamental


Understanding of research methods, demonstrated through Scientific Initiation, Master‚Äôs, Ph.D., or equivalent experience as a Data Analyst or Data Engineer.
Ability to conduct systematic literature reviews in an organized and reliable manner, acquired through Scientific Initiation, Master‚Äôs, Ph.D., or relevant professional experience.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Knowledge of essential statistics for data analysis, including distribution, hypothesis testing, and regression.
Development of data visualization skills using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, and Python.


Desirable


Hands-on experience with TensorFlow 2.0 for machine learning and deep learning projects.
Development of modern and asynchronous APIs using FastAPI.
Proficiency in using Git and GitHub for version control and collaboration on software projects.


Differential


Ability to integrate and develop applications using ChatGPT and LangChain.
Practical knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes for deploying and managing containerized applications.
Understanding of key cloud computing services offered by AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure.
Skill in using MLflow to manage the lifecycle of machine learning models.
Experience in NLP (Natural Language Processing) projects.
Experience in Computer Vision projects.


ACADEMIC BACKGROUND

Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, and related fields.

At least 2 years of experience in Python, including applications in academia, to ensure the candidate has practical skills in programming and data analysis.

Recognition of Academic Time as Experience.

Benefits


Hybrid allocation
Competitive Salary
Home Office assistance
13 salary (even you are PJ)
Payed vacation
Benefit card

Requirements And Qualifications

  • Conhecimentos s√≥lidos nos conceitos b√°sicos de Intelig√™ncia Artificial (IA), Machine Learning (ML), Deep Learning (DL) e Processamento de Linguagem Natural (PLN).

O Que Ser√° Um Diferencial

Additional information

Nossos Benef√≠cios

Sendo uma empresa voltada para pessoas, buscamos sempre valorizar a nossa equipe. Ao entrar para o Time Vetta, oferecemos:

Habilidades T√©cnicas:

Conhecimento em modelagem de s√©ries temporais (ARIMA, SARIMA, ETS, etc.) e t√©cnicas de desagrega√ß√£o.
Familiaridade com pipelines de dados (ex.: Pandas, Spark) e ferramentas de visualiza√ß√£o (ex.: Power BI, Tableau).
S√≥lidos fundamentos em estat√≠stica e econometria.
Experi√™ncia em metodologias √°geis e boas pr√°ticas de versionamento de c√≥digo (ex.: Git).

Diferenciais

Entendimento de m√©tricas de supply chain e demandas espec√≠ficas do planejamento integrado.



Informa√ß√µes adicionais

Por que trabalhar conosco?

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, AI, Insights & Solutions
Description:
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in Brazil to work in advanced analytics projects for our clients, in our factory team and/or in our own R&D team. For us, a Machine Learning Engineer is someone who has a broad knowledge of all the lifecycle of a Machine Learning project. We don‚Äôt expect you to necessarily have the deep mathematical knowledge a Data Scientist has. Nor being able to write a whole web application by yourself, as a Software Engineer does. But, you must feel very comfortable navigating between both worlds.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a fundamental role on technical decision making, embedded in projects and working with clients of different industries. You will also get your hands dirty writing code to get Machine Learning models working at real world production environments. This role teams up closely with Data Scientists, Impact Leaders, Consultants and Team Leaders to boost, deepen and streamline the development of innovative solutions that respond to high complexity problems.

What we expect from you?

Strong theoretical background on machine learning, ideally practical experience on building and deploying machine learning models.
Write code in Python, embracing good code practices.
Being able to deal with different tasks during the whole Machine Learning life cycle. What kind of tasks? ML model deployment and maintenance, building and using tools for ML monitoring, CI/CD pipeline design, supporting experimentation with ML models, designing and building data pipelines, among others.
You have experience working with cloud infrastructure.
You are familiar with the lifecycle of a Machine Learning model.
You are familiar with Containers.
You can build a service that exposes a ML Learning model to be consumed by other applications.
You love teaching others and sharing good practices.
You like getting your hands dirty with new tools and languages. Sometimes it is better to take a risk and learn something new, rather than choosing the good old hammer you always use. It doesn‚Äôt matter if you take more time, it is an investment for the future.
You like being versatile. You get bored when every day looks the same, so you like sometimes getting dressed as a Data Scientist, Data Engineer or Software Engineer.
Constant collaboration with your teammates.
Provide and accept frequent feedback.
Be autonomous within a collaborative environment.
Find the best and unique version of yourself and boost it!
You have 2 or more years of experience and a relevant graduate degree.

What can you expect working with us?

At the beginning

A big welcome!
Immediately become part of our diverse human ecosystem.
Become familiar with our tools and methodologies.
You will have a buddy who will support you in everything related with your entry.
You will have a Professional Development (PD) advisor to support you in your professional development.

During your first case

Start with one of our clients in a project that has a clear scope and timeline.
Be exposed to the inner-workings of a company and challenges.
Interaction! You will have to relate with team mates as well as with clients in a dynamic style.
Deploy a model into production that will directly impact reality.
Start your PD plan inside AAG.
You will receive continuous feedback from your team and leadership.

In between cases

It is common that when you end up a project, you have time until you are assigned into another project. This window is specially important so you can:

Cool down and recover energies for next project.
Document knowledge for the internal and external community.
Join our R&D Lab and help us put into practice state-of-the-art and recently published AI papers.
Write an article to publish on our engineering Medium.

During your second case

You will tackle a second problem, ideally different from your last project.
As long as you learn new techniques, the complexity of your proposed solutions will grow.
You will start walking ahead in your PD with your advisor.
By then, you will have participated in one of our summits, a 3-day retreat where we spend time reflecting on the things we do but mainly having fun!

And from there

You will be staffed to different projects in different industries.
You will share with your colleagues your success and your failures.
You will strengthen your critical thinking and be able to propose suitable solutions for each challenge.
You will have the space to explore topics of your interest and write articles to consolidate your knowledge and share it with your colleagues.
You will have space to work in pro-bono projects.
You will participate in summits every 6 months, where you will get to know better your teammates.

Benefits

Apple equipment.
Maternity and Paternity leave: birth and non-birth parents will be eligible to receive 26 weeks* of paid leave.
Life and medical insurance.
Supplementary Health and Dental Insurance.
Yearly bonus based on performance.
Leave of Absence: unpaid break of 1-12 months (eligible after 1 year working with us).
Gympass: experience fitness and wellness with gyms, studios and apps.
Headspace: annual free subscription to the app that will provide Meditation and mindfulness for any mind, any mood, any goal.
Language study subsidy (Spanish, Portuguese and English).

Note: some benefits may differ depending on location and could be subject to change.

  • By then, you will have participated in one of our summits, a 3-day retreat where we spend time reflecting on the things we do but mainly having fun!

And from there

  • You will share with your colleagues your success and your failures.
  • You will strengthen your critical thinking and be able to propose suitable solutions for each challenge.
  • You will have the space to explore topics of your interest and write articles to consolidate your knowledge and share it with your colleagues.
  • You will have space to work in pro-bono projects.
  • You will participate in summits every 6 months, where you will get to know better your teammates.

Benefits

  • Apple equipment.
  • Maternity and Paternity leave: birth and non-birth parents will be eligible to receive 26 weeks* of paid leave.
  • Life and medical insurance.
  • Supplementary Health and Dental Insurance.
  • Yearly bonus based on performance.
  • Leave of Absence: unpaid break of 1-12 months (eligible after 1 year working with us).
  • Gympass: experience fitness and wellness with gyms, studios and apps.
  • Headspace: annual free subscription to the app that will provide Meditation and mindfulness for any mind, any mood, any goal.
  • Language study subsidy (Spanish, Portuguese and English).

Note: some benefits may differ depending on location and could be subject to change.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Experimentation
HTML:
About the Team


We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Sao Paulo team, specifically in Core Services Analytics.


You will work with product managers, engineers, and fellow data scientists to shape the direction of one or more products within Core Services. You will work on fast-moving, high-stakes problems reaching a global audience. A deep analytical passion and the ability to execute key business priorities is a must for this role.


Notes about the profile: If you are interested in advanced modeling and production modeling, this role is not it! We have a separate Applied Science team that works on these types of projects.


About the Role


  • Analyze key data assets to understand our payment experiences;
  • Develop and monitor strategic metrics and understand all underlying factors;
  • Design and run experiments to analyze the impact of product changes;
  • Deep dive into data to evaluate proposed product changes and identify opportunities for improving the user experience;
  • Collaborate with product managers and other business leaders to make decisions based on data insights and experiment results;
  • Communicate your findings to cross-functional peers and management.



Technical Skills


Required:


  • Advanced English skills;
  • Senior and/or Staff seniority in a Business/Data/Science role (6yrs+ of experience);
  • Previous experience improving products, understanding the user journey, and extracting insights from data;
  • Advanced SQL expertise;
  • Solid experience using Python or R;
  • Experience launching multiple experiments (such as A/B experiments) and an understanding of experimental design and using statistical methods in exploratory analysis;
  • Casual Inference experience is a huge plus;
  • Bachelors or M.S. in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields.



Please note: this hybrid position is based in S√£o Paulo, Brazil - welcoming both local professionals and those open to relocating to S√£o Paulo.

Title: Data Scientist - AI, Insights & Solutions
Description:
What we do

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join Bain‚Äôs Advanced Analytics Group (AAG). ¬†As part of AAG, you will work with other members of AAG, Bain Generalist Consultants and our AAG Factory team to build robust data solutions that interact with our Data Science and Machine Learning models to serve our clients needs.¬†We achieve this in two distinct ways:

Working with consulting teams on short-term projects which involve developing software solutions
Developing and maintaining long-lasting products that support internal or clients needs

At Bain, we work with leading companies innovating with data, often involving building digital products.

Many times, in the early stages of experimentation, we have to develop immature digital products as proofs of concept. Those can go from deploying a microservice with a predictive model, to quickly implementing pipelines that integrate client data with the developed products/models.

When any of those tests show potential value, we need to scale them up and help the team capture that unlocked value. Sometimes, this means transforming an immature digital project or product into a stable, usable, and resilient one and bring the most value to our clients.

Because of this, we are searching for innovative and fresh minds that want to join us to create elegant yet practical solutions to deal with the most challenging problems.

Who we are looking for

We are not looking for an expert on a specific domain or analytics framework. Instead, we are seeking people who have strong Data Science experience and feel comfortable moving through different types of data analysis and modeling challenges.

We are looking for individuals with experience building data-driven solutions, training machine learning models and integrating advanced analytics into business processes. Also, people that has worked with diverse data sources across different domains, and who can collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to drive insights and create analytic solutions from data.

While you may already have experience with certain tools or platforms, we encourage you to continually learn and adopt new technologies as you move forward. We want you to see learning as a challenge to embrace, not a chore

What we expect from you:

Enjoy learning new methodologies, tools and technologies
Familiar with statistics, linear algebra, databases and programming
Write code in Python
Skilled at manipulating data, extracting insights and communicating them through visualizations
Experience training machine learning models ‚Äì both supervised and unsupervised
Comfortable using Git for versioning and collaborating
Strong interpersonal and communication skills to coordinate with both technical and business oriented team members
Have 1 or more years of experience and a graduation degree

We are interested in you working with an interdisciplinary team where there are other roles who code and for you to be a reference regarding data science. Also, we need you to feel comfortable at every stage of a project: whether you are putting together a prototype of a crazy idea (that we don‚Äôt know what it‚Äôs going to evolve into), building production projects or leading the continuous improvement of an ongoing product.

About us

At Bain we say ‚ÄúChampion the bold to achieve the extraordinary‚Äù. In the Advanced Analytics Group we deeply embody that statement; we put remarkable data innovators in front of the world's toughest challenges, delivering impact that goes way beyond businesses. By doing that, we aim to challenge the status quo and redefine the domains in which we work.

We are building the most influential data innovation hub in South America. We are looking for creative yet courageous professionals like you to play a key role in helping us pursue this endeavor.

What can you expect from us?

We are people centered and team players: we want to provide an awesome environment to work and grow. An environment where we care about people, our wellbeing and a healthy and vibrant long term development. We believe in a place where autonomy is at the core, and where servant leadership provides direction, guidance and motivation, enabling the best version of each of us so we can build teams based on trust and where we help others shine.

We deliver positive impact and challenge the status quo: we are obsessed with unleashing our clients full potential by developing quick and dirty data products that evolve fast through agile experimentation. We design a vision not conquered yet, and we only seek to make it a reality and bring true impact to the domains we work on. Be it a very complex operational mining process, an NGO‚Äôs educational challenge, a retailer‚Äôs e-commerce, or a climate change endeavor, we bring state-of-the-art advanced analytics techniques to create new superior realities for our clients.

We are playful and seek for uniqueness: complex problems require thinking out-of-the-box, giving room to challenging ideas and points of view. How we enable that? By nurturing creativity and having fun exploring novel paths and promoting curiosity and learning in empowered teams that take seriously their instincts and passions. We‚Äôve seen over and over again that this never-ending learning philosophy make us better and stronger, broaden our capability range and enlighten our version in the future to tackle challenges that we haven‚Äôt seen before.

We‚Äôd love if:

You are a curious person.
You are obsessed by learning new things, tackling new problems and being constantly challenged.
You describe yourself as a proactive and creative person.
You don‚Äôt feel bad facing failure, instead you learn the reason behind it and learn from it.
You value learning from others, but you also love learning by yourself and teaching yourself new skills.
You value when things are well-written, so you put your best effort on it.¬†Be it code, documentation or an email.
You feel comfortable reading, writing and speaking in English.
You speak Spanish or Portuguese (‚≠êÔ∏è¬†if you dominate both).
You have strong communication skills and feel comfortable working with people that have different roles and seniority levels.
You enjoy working on constantly iterative processes.
You embrace a deep respect for diversity.

Title: Junior ML Engineer
Description:
About Translated

Translated is a leading company in AI-enabled translation services. We are on a mission to allow everyone to understand and be understood in their own language.

By leveraging a seamless symbiosis of artificial intelligence and human creativity, we design custom localization projects that were previously unthinkable, helping more than 280,000 clients grow their businesses worldwide.

Translated has been at the forefront of innovation in the language services industry, actively coordinating several European projects such as Matecat, MMT, Meetween. Through these leading AI research initiatives, Translated has collaborated with esteemed partners like FBK, Zoom Research, and Kites. These partnerships have concentrated on advancing state-of-the-art technology, steering the industry towards more efficient and intelligent solutions for machine translation and beyond.

We are looking for a Junior ML Engineer. As a Junior ML Engineer at Translated, you will contribute to deploying state-of-the-art models in production environments, converting research breakthroughs into practical solutions that enhance and expand our AI services. If you are passionate about making AI technology accessible and impactful, this position offers you the opportunity to make a meaningful impact.

What You‚Äôll Do


Deploy advanced machine learning models to address real-world challenges, transforming Translated's research from concept to reality and developing impactful AI-driven solutions.
Implement fast and scalable Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines.
Introduce state-of-the-art techniques, tools, and architecture that improve the performance, latency, throughput, and efficiency of our model inference stack.
Monitor and maintain deployed models to ensure they consistently provide value, directly impacting the role of AI in serving individuals and businesses.
Manage project lifecycle autonomously, from planning to deployment, with guidance from senior team members.
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of machine learning researchers, engineers, product owners, designers and system administrators.
Participate in continuous learning opportunities to stay ahead in the fast-evolving field of AI and Machine Translation.


Requirements


Master's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Proficiency in Java and Python.
Strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
Some hands-on experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines.
Have an understanding of modern LLM architectures and an intuition for how to optimize their performance, particularly for inference.
Proactive, self-driven and enjoys solving complex problems, not just in the primary area of responsibility but across boundaries.
Ability to move quickly in an environment where things may be loosely defined with competing priorities or deadlines.
Enjoys owning problems end-to-end and is willing to acquire any necessary knowledge to complete the job.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the capacity to convey technical concepts to non-expert audiences.


Preferred Qualifications


2+ years industry/equivalent experience.
Experience in serving and optimizing LLMs inference processes.


We offer: full-time contract. This position requires daily in-office presence, so we are unable to accommodate fully remote work. However, we value flexibility and offer the opportunity to work up to 48 days remotely per year, allowing for a balanced and adaptable work experience.

Headquarter

Translated is hosted at Pi Campus, a working environment immersed in nature where 5 luxury villas have been converted into functional offices to foster talent growth. Pi Campus is also a venture firm created by Translated to reinvest part of its profits into promising AI startups.

Benefits and Perks


Gym
Swimming Pool
Kickboxing
Water aerobics
Fitness
Pilates
Table Tennis and Football table
Kitchen and snacks
Bonuses and incentives for employees who quit smoking, ride a bicycle to work, or adopt a child.


Learn more about our company: https://translated.com/work-at-translated-onboarding.

Diversity Statement

At Translated, we proudly embrace and celebrate each individual's unique qualities to our team, regardless of race, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other differences. We recognize that these diverse perspectives empower us to overcome challenges, foster innovation, and drive excellence. As an inclusive and equal opportunity employer, we are committed to cultivating an environment where everyone feels welcome, valued, and supported to achieve their full potential.

Privacy Policy

Title: Data Scientist Specialista
Company: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS
Description:
Titolo del Progetto: QuantItative MRI for PRostate Online AdaptiVe DosE Painting MRgRT (IMPROVER)

(AIRC I ANNO n. 31024)




La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS, World‚Äôs Best Hospital per il terzo anno consecutivo secondo la classifica Newsweek e unico italiano nella top 40 a livello mondiale.

La sua Mission √® quella di affermarsi nelle seguenti aree di maggior rilievo:

Innovazione, Cura, Ricerca e Solidariet√†

CHI CERCHIAMO?

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS √® alla ricerca di persone con spirito d'iniziativa e capacit√† innovative, approccio alla multidisciplinariet√† e al lavoro di gruppo, con voglia di intraprendere un percorso insieme nell‚Äôeccellenza professionale sanitaria in un contesto sfidante ed internazionale.

Sei pronto a metterti in gioco?

CHI STIAMO CERCANDO

RUOLO:

Data Scientist specialista




AMBITO DI INSERIMENTO:

Il progetto IMPROVER (QuantItative MRI for PRostate Online AdaptiVe DosE Painting MRgRT), finanziato dalla Fondazione AIRC per la Ricerca sul Cancro (MFAG 2024, ID 31024) per una durata di cinque anni, mira a rivoluzionare il trattamento del cancro alla prostata attraverso l'integrazione di tecnologie avanzate di imaging e terapia, utilizzando l‚Äôintelligenza artificiale. Gli obiettivi principali includono lo sviluppo di sequenze di risonanza magnetica multi-parametrica ottimizzate per i sistemi MRI-LINAC a 0.35 T, la creazione di un workflow basato su AI per l'identificazione e la segmentazione automatica dei tumori e la loro eterogeneit√†, e la generazione di immagini CT sintetiche per migliorare la pianificazione radioterapica. Il progetto culmina nell'integrazione di queste innovazioni in un flusso di lavoro esclusivamente basato su MRI, per supportare trattamenti radioterapici adattivi e personalizzati in tempo reale, per aumentare l'efficacia e ridurne gli effetti collaterali.




REQUISITI DEL RUOLO:

Laurea in Data Science, Ingegneria Biomedica, Informatica, Fisica.
Competenza nell'analisi ed elaborazione di dati e bioimmagini.
Esperienza nello sviluppo di modelli predittivi di machine learning e deep-learning.
Conoscenza avanzata di linguaggi di programmazione: Python, MatLAB&Simulink, R, C++.
Conoscenza avanzata dei sistemi operativi Linux e Windows.
Esperienza nell'ambito della ricerca clinica e traslazionale in team multidisciplinari.
Scientific writing.
Analisi critica.
Ottime capacitaÃÄ relazionali e organizzative.
Flessibilit√†ÃÄ e attitudine al problem solving.
Motivazione e predisposizione al lavoro di squadra.
Conoscenza della lingua inglese.




ATTIVITA‚Äô DEL RUOLO:

La risorsa si occuper√† di:




Sviluppare, ottimizzare e implementare clinicamente un workflow AI-based per l'identificazione e la segmentazione automatica dei tumori della prostata, in grado anche di caratterizzare l‚Äôeterogeneit√† dell‚Äôhabitat tumorale su immagini di un MRI-LINAC a 0.35 T
Ottimizzare e implementare clinicamente un algoritmo di deep learning per sintetizzare immagini CT della pelvi maschile da immagini MRI TRUFI a 0.35 T
Supportare la validazione esterna del workflow proposto dal progetto IMPROVER in altre istituzioni (Ospedale San Pietro Fatebenefratelli, Mater Olbia Hospital, Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria Integrata Verona) su un sistema MRI-LINAC a 0.35 T, consentendo di supportare prospetticamente studi e trial multi-istituzionali sul tumore della prostata e su altri potenziali siti.
Supportare la validazione esterna del workflow proposto dal progetto IMPROVER sia in un diverso sistema di MRI-LINAC a 1.5 T (IRCCS Sacro Cuore Don Calabria) che per un sistema che utilizza una risonanza magnetica diagnostica come simulatore dedicato per i LINAC convenzionali (Policlinico Abano, Presidio Ospedaliero Regione Veneto).




COMPLETANO IL PROFILO:

Gradita la Specializzazione in Fisica Medica (se laurea in Fisica)
Gradita l‚Äôiscrizione all‚ÄôAlbo Nazionale dei Fisici Medici (se specialista in fisica medica)
Gradito il dottorato di ricerca con focus su image analysis, machine learning, deep learning
Gradita esperienza in medical imaging processing e analysis
Esperienza nello sviluppo e nell‚Äôimplementazione di algoritmi di deep learning e machine learning
Esperienza di software development engineering







TIPOLOGIA CONTRATTUALE OFFERTA:

Contratto di collaborazione coordinata e continuativa










COSA TROVERAI

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS offre un‚Äôesperienza unica dal punto di vista umano e professionale, che consiste nel far parte di team che lavorano per obiettivi comuni sposando i valori dell‚ÄôEtica e del Rispetto.

Un ambiente stimolante e sfidante che abbraccia il cambiamento in ogni sua forma
La possibilit√† di lavorare in modalit√† agile e flessibile all‚Äôinterno di spazi di co-working nuovi e pensati per la collaborazione
Apprendimento continuo per lo sviluppo del sapere professionale, scientifico e tecnico attraverso percorsi formativi personalizzati
Una realt√† che persegue obiettivi sostenibili allo scopo di salvaguardare il nostro pianeta e le nostre Persone
Una struttura che favorisce la Diversity ed Inclusion. Lavorerai in team con Persone di et√† diverse, culture diverse, storie diverse. Crediamo che la Diversit√† crei scambio di Idee e lo scambio di Idee crei Valore.
L‚Äôopportunit√† di accesso a percorsi di carriera nel rispetto dei principi di equit√† e valorizzazione del merito.




GLI INGREDIENTI CHE ACCOMUNANO LE NOSTRE PERSONE

La Passione per il cosa si fa: √® ci√≤ che muove tutti noi a lavorare quotidianamente con competenza e professionalit√† al fine di Migliorare la Vita di ognuno di Noi.

L‚ÄôImpegno per l‚ÄôInnovazione: in quanto centro di Ricerca accogliamo il cambiamento ed il progresso continuo.

La Responsabilit√† etica e sociale: ci dedichiamo costantemente a realizzare progettualit√† legate alla sostenibilit√† sociale, perch√© riteniamo che ognuno di noi pu√≤ dare il proprio contributo lavorando con integrit√†, trasparenza ed onest√† in tutte le azioni




SU DI NOI

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS si conferma come il luogo in cui competenze scientifiche e tecniche, sensibilit√† umana, etica e valori cattolici diventano un impegno concreto per cure eccellenti e accessibili all‚Äôintera comunit√†. Il valore che viene quotidianamente posto al centro dell‚Äôoperare √®, fin dalle origini, la cura della persona malata, nel rispetto integrale della sua dignit√†, dei suoi bisogni, della sua sofferenza e della sua speranza.

LO SAPEVI CHE?

Nel 2018 √® stato riconosciuto il carattere scientifico del Policlinico Gemelli per le discipline di ‚ÄúMedicina Personalizzata‚Äù e di ‚ÄúBiotecnologie innovative‚Äù, diventando un Istituto di Ricovero e Cura a Carattere Scientifico (IRCCS)

Titolo del Progetto: QuantItative MRI for PRostate Online AdaptiVe DosE Painting MRgRT (IMPROVER)

(AIRC I ANNO n. 31024)


La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS, World‚Äôs Best Hospital per il terzo anno consecutivo secondo la classifica Newsweek e unico italiano nella top 40 a livello mondiale.

La sua Mission √® quella di affermarsi nelle seguenti aree di maggior rilievo:

Innovazione, Cura, Ricerca e Solidariet√†

CHI CERCHIAMO?

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS √® alla ricerca di persone con spirito d'iniziativa e capacit√† innovative, approccio alla multidisciplinariet√† e al lavoro di gruppo, con voglia di intraprendere un percorso insieme nell‚Äôeccellenza professionale sanitaria in un contesto sfidante ed internazionale.

Sei pronto a metterti in gioco?

CHI STIAMO CERCANDO

RUOLO:

Data Scientist specialista


AMBITO DI INSERIMENTO:

Il progetto IMPROVER (QuantItative MRI for PRostate Online AdaptiVe DosE Painting MRgRT), finanziato dalla Fondazione AIRC per la Ricerca sul Cancro (MFAG 2024, ID 31024) per una durata di cinque anni, mira a rivoluzionare il trattamento del cancro alla prostata attraverso l'integrazione di tecnologie avanzate di imaging e terapia, utilizzando l‚Äôintelligenza artificiale. Gli obiettivi principali includono lo sviluppo di sequenze di risonanza magnetica multi-parametrica ottimizzate per i sistemi MRI-LINAC a 0.35 T, la creazione di un workflow basato su AI per l'identificazione e la segmentazione automatica dei tumori e la loro eterogeneit√†, e la generazione di immagini CT sintetiche per migliorare la pianificazione radioterapica. Il progetto culmina nell'integrazione di queste innovazioni in un flusso di lavoro esclusivamente basato su MRI, per supportare trattamenti radioterapici adattivi e personalizzati in tempo reale, per aumentare l'efficacia e ridurne gli effetti collaterali.


REQUISITI DEL RUOLO:

  • Laurea in Data Science, Ingegneria Biomedica, Informatica, Fisica.
  • Competenza nell'analisi ed elaborazione di dati e bioimmagini.
  • Esperienza nello sviluppo di modelli predittivi di machine learning e deep-learning.
  • Conoscenza avanzata di linguaggi di programmazione: Python, MatLAB&Simulink, R, C++.
  • Conoscenza avanzata dei sistemi operativi Linux e Windows.
  • Esperienza nell'ambito della ricerca clinica e traslazionale in team multidisciplinari.
  • Scientific writing.
  • Analisi critica.
  • Ottime capacitaÃÄ relazionali e organizzative.
  • Flessibilit√†ÃÄ e attitudine al problem solving.
  • Motivazione e predisposizione al lavoro di squadra.
  • Conoscenza della lingua inglese.


ATTIVITA‚Äô DEL RUOLO:

La risorsa si occuper√† di:


  • Sviluppare, ottimizzare e implementare clinicamente un workflow AI-based per l'identificazione e la segmentazione automatica dei tumori della prostata, in grado anche di caratterizzare l‚Äôeterogeneit√† dell‚Äôhabitat tumorale su immagini di un MRI-LINAC a 0.35 T
  • Ottimizzare e implementare clinicamente un algoritmo di deep learning per sintetizzare immagini CT della pelvi maschile da immagini MRI TRUFI a 0.35 T
  • Supportare la validazione esterna del workflow proposto dal progetto IMPROVER in altre istituzioni (Ospedale San Pietro Fatebenefratelli, Mater Olbia Hospital, Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria Integrata Verona) su un sistema MRI-LINAC a 0.35 T, consentendo di supportare prospetticamente studi e trial multi-istituzionali sul tumore della prostata e su altri potenziali siti.
  • Supportare la validazione esterna del workflow proposto dal progetto IMPROVER sia in un diverso sistema di MRI-LINAC a 1.5 T (IRCCS Sacro Cuore Don Calabria) che per un sistema che utilizza una risonanza magnetica diagnostica come simulatore dedicato per i LINAC convenzionali (Policlinico Abano, Presidio Ospedaliero Regione Veneto).


COMPLETANO IL PROFILO:

  • Gradita la Specializzazione in Fisica Medica (se laurea in Fisica)
  • Gradita l‚Äôiscrizione all‚ÄôAlbo Nazionale dei Fisici Medici (se specialista in fisica medica)
  • Gradito il dottorato di ricerca con focus su image analysis, machine learning, deep learning
  • Gradita esperienza in medical imaging processing e analysis
  • Esperienza nello sviluppo e nell‚Äôimplementazione di algoritmi di deep learning e machine learning
  • Esperienza di software development engineering



TIPOLOGIA CONTRATTUALE OFFERTA:

Contratto di collaborazione coordinata e continuativa

  • La possibilit√† di lavorare in modalit√† agile e flessibile all‚Äôinterno di spazi di co-working nuovi e pensati per la collaborazione
  • Apprendimento continuo per lo sviluppo del sapere professionale, scientifico e tecnico attraverso percorsi formativi personalizzati
  • Una realt√† che persegue obiettivi sostenibili allo scopo di salvaguardare il nostro pianeta e le nostre Persone
  • Una struttura che favorisce la Diversity ed Inclusion. Lavorerai in team con Persone di et√† diverse, culture diverse, storie diverse. Crediamo che la Diversit√† crei scambio di Idee e lo scambio di Idee crei Valore.
  • L‚Äôopportunit√† di accesso a percorsi di carriera nel rispetto dei principi di equit√† e valorizzazione del merito.

HTML:

  • Conoscenza di Python e delle librerie per la manipolazione dei dati e sviluppo di modelli (pandas, tensorflow, scikit-learn, pytorch, llamaIndex, langChaing, ecc‚Ä¶);
  • Conoscenza della gestione del versioning del codice (Git); √® ritenuto nice to have la familiarit√† con piattaforme come DevOps per il CI/CD e Docker sar√† considerata un plus.

Le risorse individuate saranno coinvolte in un percorso formativo che consentir√† loro di acquisire rapidamente nuove competenze specifiche e di svolgere le seguenti attivit√†:


  • Progettazione e sviluppo di soluzioni di Machine Learning, Generative AI (RAG) e analisi dati per i clienti;
  • Utilizzo di strumenti e linguaggi per la manipolazione dei dati: SQL, MongoDB, Neo4j, Spark, Databricks;
  • Sviluppo di modelli predittivi tramite tecniche di Machine Learning e/o Deep Learning per NLP/NLU, Computer Vision, Time Series e analisi dei grafi di conoscenza;
  • Gestione end-to-end di progetti analitici: dall‚Äôesigenza di business alla comunicazione efficace dei risultati di analisi;
  • Creazione di dashboard e insight per semplificare il processo decisionale degli stakeholder.

Title: Data Scientist - Sost.maternit√†
HTML:
Descrizione del lavoro

REFERRAL 1

Attivita‚Äô

  • Sviluppare modelli predittivi end-to-end per tutte le BU, quali Marketing, Trading e Gaming;
  • Monitorare settimanalmente e mensilmente KPI e andamento dei modelli gi√† rilasciati;
  • Monitoraggio e troubleshooting dei processi in essere;
  • Gestire i modelli di segmentazione, propensity scoring e regressione supportandone l‚Äôanalisi descrittiva;
  • Collaborare alla definizione del ciclo di vita dei clienti Eurobet attraverso l‚Äôidentificazione, la differenziazione in base al loro valore e al loro comportamento di gioco;
  • Monitorare i risultati del pLTV dei clienti e del loro relativo ROI, con focus sui diversi canali di acquisizione;
  • Relazione con il dipartimento IT per concordare la migliore soluzione di preparazione del dato;
  • Crea matematiche di gioco, partendo da una matematica base ed effettuando simulazioni in python per il calcolo dell RTP.

Caratteristiche

  • Laurea in Matematica/Statistica, o equivalenti;
  • Ottima conoscenza dei sistemi di analisti statistica e delle tecniche di Data Mining attraverso almeno uno dei seguenti software: Python, PySpark;
  • Esperienza base nelle fasi di realizzazione di un modello predittivo;
  • Forte interesse verso la matematica, in particolare nell‚Äôambito della Teoria dei giochi;
  • Conoscenza e interesse verso la piattaforma Google Cloud;
  • Risulta un plus la conoscenza del software Tableau: dall‚Äôestrazione dei dati alla creazione di dashboard utili a diffondere l‚Äôinformazione dei dati ai propri colleghi;
  • Nozioni nell‚Äôambito MLops;
  • Conoscenza base della lingua inglese;
  • Buone capacit√† organizzative, determinazione e un atteggiamento costruttivo nell'affrontare i problemi;
  • Capacit√† di gestire con confidenzialit√† le informazioni con le quali si entra in contatto;
  • Buona propensione al lavoro in team, spirito di iniziativa e condivisione;
  • La passione per gli sport di maggiore interesse in Italia √® titolo preferenziale non essenziale.

Informazioni aggiuntive

Entra a far parte della nostra azienda: ecco quello che abbiamo riservato per te!

  • Lavoro flessibile con modello di Smart Working consolidato;
  • I nostri uffici sono sempre aperti: il contatto, il clima aziendale e il confronto con i tuoi colleghi/e sono la nostra forza per trovare sempre l‚Äôispirazione giusta;
  • Ticket restaurant giornalieri, sia nei giorni on site che quando lavori da remoto;
  • Assicurazione Sanitaria integrativa per te e la tua famiglia;
  • Agevolazione sull‚Äôacquisto dell‚Äôabbonamento ai trasporti pubblici;
  • Un programma di Wellbeing che si rinnova continuamente: Padel, Yoga, Canottaggio per i pi√π sportivi, lo sportello counseling e percorsi di formazione sul benessere e sulla resilienza sono solo alcune delle attivit√† a cui potrai accedere;
  • Progetti strutturati sulla DE&I.

At Entain, we do what's right. It's one of our core values and that's why we're taking the lead when it comes to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive future - for our people, and the wider global sports betting and gaming sector. However you identify, our ambition is to ensure our people across the globe feel valued, respected and their individuality celebrated.

Title: AI Expert
Description:
A Joint Venture between Thales (67%) and Leonardo (33%), Thales Alenia Space is a global space manufacturer delivering, for more than 40 years, high-tech solutions for telecommunications, navigation, Earth Observation, environmental management, exploration, science and orbital infrastructures. Thanks to our diversity of skills, talents and cultures, our customers (governments, institutions, space agencies, telecommunications operators), therefore have Space to Connect, Secure & Defend, Observe & Protect, Explore, Travel & Navigate.

Artificial Intelligence Engineering

CANDIDATES THAT WOULD IMPRESS US

PROFILE:

You graduated from an Engineering School with a master‚Äôs degree ‚Äì a PhD is a plus

Your level of experience ranges from junior to advance: you are a student OR/AND you have already occupied one or more positions among the following: Algorithm or Software Engineer, Artificial Intelligence Engineer

You are curious and willing to stay abreast of the latest trends (technical, philosophical, ethical by design)

You enjoy thinking "outside the box" and use your creativity to address complex challenges

You are recognised as a team player and promote collaborative work

You are user centric and want to design components accordingly

COMPETENCIES:

You have in-depth knowledge in mathematics, algorithms, experiment plan, continuous iterations and Agility

You are proficient in one of the following Artificial Intelligence Approches:

Data driven AI, Symbolic AI, Hybrid AI on the Solution

Symbolic Artificial Intelligence and reasoning

Human/machine dialog

Systems Analysis

You understand the norms, laws and standards

You have knowledge of cybersecurity

You can confidently discuss with people from different jobs and background

You master foundational concepts in mathematics/ statistics science and their application to deploy them on Solution studies: statistical modelling, linear algebra, optimisation, machine learning Mathematics and Statistics

LIFE AS A THALES ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE ENGINEERING ROLE

As an Artificial Intelligence Engineering Role within Thales, you will:

Design and develop trustworthy artificial intelligence components for various domains

Identify the right cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence technologies (machine learning, symbolic AI, dialogue) and develop the Artificial Intelligence component accordingly

Work on Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Understanding (NLU), and also to design multimodal approaches for Human-Machin Dialog including intention understanding, reasoning and hybrid AI

Work on Machine Learning, causality vs. correlation, and/or other Data driven AI technics such as Random Forest, Evolutionary Algorithms, ‚Ä¶

Work on Symbolic AI, Ontology, Semantic Web, Knowledge based Reasoning, Meta-heuristics, Problem Solving, Operations Research, Decision Making and reasoning

Propose and design approach alternatives

Integrate scientific method into engineering system methodology

Ensure data knowledge and traceability

Ensure continuous technowatch and be aware of the latest trends (technical, philosophical, ethical by design)

Define the system capabilities thanks to a functional, logical and value analysis, describing functions to be performed to meet the real needs of the user in the various scenarii and maximising product value for Customer

YOUR CAREER AT THALES

Future opportunities will allow you to discover other domains or sites. You will be able to evolve and grow your competences in different areas:

Room and attention to personal development

Build your talents in another domain of Thales Group, discovering new products, new customers, new country or go to a more complex Solution

Choose between a technical expertise or a leadership path

Build an international career within a leading Engineering Group

At Thales Alenia Space we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales Alenia Space employing around 8,900 employees in 10 countries with 17 sites in Europe and a plant in the US, our mobility policy enables employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad. Thales Alenia Space sees space as a new horizon, helping to build a better, more sustainable life on Earth #SpaceForLife. Great journeys start here, apply now!
